how_to_help: Offer emotional support, encourage professional help, and be patient and understanding.
description: A mood disorder characterized by persistent feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and loss of interest in activities.

how_to_help: Listen without judgment, encourage relaxation techniques, and support their treatment plan.
description: A chronic condition characterized by excessive, long-lasting anxiety and worries about nonspecific life events, objects, and situations.

how_to_help: Learn about the condition, be supportive during mood episodes, and encourage medication adherence.
description: A mental health condition that causes extreme mood swings that include emotional highs (mania or hypomania) and lows (depression).

how_to_help: Encourage treatment adherence, provide a calm environment, and be patient and supportive.
description: A chronic and severe mental disorder that affects how a person thinks, feels, and behaves, often experiencing reality abnormally.

how_to_help: Don't enable compulsions, encourage treatment, and educate yourself about OCD.
description: A mental health disorder characterized by uncontrollable, reoccurring thoughts (obsessions) and/or behaviors (compulsions) that a person feels the urge to repeat over and over.

how_to_help: Provide a safe environment, be patient, and encourage professional help.
description: A mental health condition triggered by experiencing or witnessing a terrifying event, causing flashbacks, nightmares, and severe anxiety.

symptoms: Physical symptoms like sweating or trembling
how_to_help: Offer gentle encouragement, respect their boundaries, and celebrate small victories.
description: A chronic mental health condition where social interactions cause irrational anxiety, fear, self-consciousness, and embarrassment.

symptoms: Obsession with food and body image
how_to_help: Focus on emotional support rather than food, encourage professional help, and avoid body-shaming language.
description: Serious conditions related to persistent eating behaviors that negatively impact health, emotions, and ability to function in important areas of life.

how_to_help: Help with organization, be patient with forgetfulness, and encourage professional treatment.
description: A chronic condition including attention difficulty, hyperactivity, and impulsiveness, often beginning in childhood and potentially continuing into adulthood.

how_to_help: Set clear boundaries, encourage therapy, and avoid reinforcing harmful behaviors.
description: A mental health disorder characterized by unstable moods, behavior, and relationships, often marked by intense emotions and impulsivity.

symptoms: Physical symptoms like chest pain or shortness of breath
how_to_help: Stay calm during attacks, encourage deep breathing, and support their treatment plan.
description: An anxiety disorder characterized by unexpected and repeated episodes of intense fear accompanied by physical symptoms.

how_to_help: Be patient, respect their sensory needs, and celebrate their unique perspectives.
description: A developmental disorder that affects communication and behavior, with a wide range of symptoms and severity.

how_to_help: Encourage professional help, avoid enabling behaviors, and offer support during recovery.
description: A complex condition in which there is uncontrolled use of a substance despite harmful consequences, often involving cycles of relapse and remission.

symptoms: Presence of two or more distinct personalities
how_to_help: Be patient and understanding, respect all identities, and encourage professional treatment.
description: A mental health condition characterized by the presence of two or more distinct personality states or identities.

symptoms: Fear of open or crowded spaces
how_to_help: Offer to accompany them to feared places, encourage gradual exposure, and be patient with their progress.
description: An anxiety disorder characterized by fear and avoidance of places and situations that might cause panic, helplessness, or embarrassment.

symptoms: Obsession with perceived flaws in appearance
how_to_help: Avoid commenting on appearance, encourage self-acceptance, and support professional treatment.
description: A mental health disorder in which a person can't stop thinking about one or more perceived defects or flaws in their appearance.

how_to_help: Avoid judgment, encourage professional help, and support stress-reduction techniques.
description: A mental disorder characterized by recurrent, irresistible urges to pull out hair from the scalp, eyebrows, or other areas of the body.

how_to_help: Encourage outdoor activities, support light therapy use, and be understanding of seasonal mood changes.
description: A type of depression related to changes in seasons, typically beginning and ending at about the same times every year.

how_to_help: Set clear boundaries, avoid feeding into grandiose beliefs, and encourage empathy and self-reflection.
description: A mental condition in which people have an inflated sense of their own importance and a deep need for excessive attention and admiration.

how_to_help: Encourage consistent sleep schedules, create a relaxing bedtime routine, and support professional treatment.
description: A common sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, or both, despite adequate opportunity for sleep.

how_to_help: Avoid forceful decluttering, encourage professional help, and offer non-judgmental support.
description: A persistent difficulty discarding or parting with possessions because of a perceived need to save them, resulting in excessive accumulation.

symptoms: Physical symptoms like bloating or breast tenderness
how_to_help: Be understanding of mood changes, encourage stress-reduction techniques, and support professional treatment.
description: A severe form of premenstrual syndrome causing extreme mood shifts that can disrupt daily life and relationships.

symptoms: Emotional or behavioral symptoms in response to a stressor
Impairment in social or occupational functioning
how_to_help: Offer emotional support, encourage healthy coping mechanisms, and be patient during the adjustment period.
description: A group of symptoms, such as stress, feeling sad or hopeless, and physical symptoms that can occur after experiencing a stressful life event.

symptoms: Intense fear of specific objects or situations
Panic attacks when exposed to phobia
how_to_help: Don't force exposure to feared objects/situations, encourage professional help, and offer support during exposure exercises.
description: An intense, irrational fear of something that poses little or no actual danger, often leading to avoidance behaviors.

how_to_help: Encourage medication adherence, provide a stable environment, and support their treatment plan.
description: A mental health disorder characterized by a combination of schizophrenia symptoms and mood disorder symptoms.

how_to_help: Offer consistent emotional support, encourage professional help, and support positive lifestyle changes.
description: A continuous, long-term form of depression characterized by a depressed mood that lasts for at least two years.

symptoms: Impairment in social or occupational functioning
how_to_help: Avoid drawing attention to skin lesions, encourage professional help, and support stress-reduction techniques.
description: A mental health condition characterized by recurrent picking at one's own skin, often resulting in skin lesions and significant distress.

how_to_help: Offer gentle encouragement for social interactions, be patient and supportive, and avoid criticism.
description: A mental health condition characterized by extreme shyness, feelings of inadequacy, and sensitivity to rejection.

how_to_help: Encourage professional help, avoid confrontations during outbursts, and support anger management techniques.
description: A behavioral disorder characterized by explosive outbursts of anger and violence, often to the point of rage, that are disproportionate to the situation at hand.
